b'For this reason, however, they must live within a lie. They need not accept the lie. It is enough for them to have accepted their life with it and in it."  12/X\n\nV\xc3\xa1clav Havel, The Power of the Powerless, 1978'

b'... to the highest functionary... Individuals need not believe all these mystifications, but they must behave as though they did, or they must at least tolerate them in silence, or get along well with those who work with them.  11/12'

b'...it enables people to deceive their conscience and conceal their true position and their inglorious modus vivendi, both from the world and from themselves. It is an excuse that everyone can use, from the greengrocer, who conceals his fear of losing his job... 10/12'
b'Ideology is a specious way of relating to the world. It offers human beings the illusion of an identity, of dignity, and of morality while making it easier for them to part with them. 9/12'

b'It must allow the greengrocer to say, \xe2\x80\x98What\xe2\x80\x99s wrong with the workers of the world uniting?\xe2\x80\x99 Thus the sign helps the greengrocer to conceal from himself the low foundations of his obedience... It hides them behind the fa\xc3\xa7ade of something high... that something is ideology. 8/12'

b'The greengrocer would be embarrassed and ashamed to put such an unequivocal statement of his own degradation... To overcome this complication, his expression of loyalty must take the form of a sign...  7/12'

b'...if the greengrocer had been instructed to display the slogan, \xe2\x80\x98I am afraid and therefore unquestioningly obedient\xe2\x80\x99, he would not be nearly as indifferent to its semantics, even though the statement would reflect the truth.  6/12'

b'...The slogan is really a sign, and as such it contains a subliminal but very definite message... \xe2\x80\x98I, the greengrocer XY, live here and I know what I must do. I behave in the manner expected of me... I am obedient and therefore I have the right to be left in peace.\xe2\x80\x99  5/12'

b'If he were to refuse, there could be trouble. He could be reproached for not having the proper \xe2\x80\x98decoration\xe2\x80\x99 in his window; someone might even accuse him of disloyalty. He does it because these things must be done if one is to get along in life.  4/12'

b'That poster was delivered to our greengrocer from the enterprise headquarters along with the onions and carrots. He put them all into the window simply... because everyone does it, and because that is the way it has to be.  3/12'

b'Is his enthusiasm so great that he feels an irrepressible impulse to acquaint the public with his ideals? Has he really given more than a moment\xe2\x80\x99s thought to how such a unification might occur and what it would mean?  2/12'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve now received so many death threats I could paper the house with them, and I haven\xe2\x80\x99t stopped speaking out. Perhaps \xe2\x80\x93 and I\xe2\x80\x99m just throwing this out there \xe2\x80\x93 the best way to prove your movement isn\xe2\x80\x99t a threat to women, is to stop stalking, harassing and threatening us. 8/X'

b'I have to assume that @IAmGeorgiaFrost, @hollywstars and @Richard_Energy_ thought doxxing me would intimidate me out of speaking up for women\xe2\x80\x99s sex-based rights. They should have reflected on the fact that 7/8'

b'None of these women are protected in the way I am. They and their families have been put into a state of fear and distress for no other reason than that they refuse to uncritically accept that the socio-political concept of gender identity should replace that of sex. 6/8'

b'but who\xe2\x80\x99ve contacted me to relate their experiences, have been subject to campaigns of intimidation which range from being hounded on social media, the targeting of their employers, all the way up to doxing and direct threats of violence, including rape. 5/8'

b'Over the last few years I\xe2\x80\x99ve watched, appalled, as women like Allison Bailey, Raquel Sanchez, Marion Miller, Rosie Duffield, Joanna Cherry, Julie Bindel, Rosa Freedman, Kathleen Stock and many, many others, including women who have no public profile 4/8'
b'I implore those people who retweeted the image with the address still visible, even if they did so in condemnation of these people\xe2\x80\x99s actions, to delete it. 3/8'

b'I want to say a massive thank you to everybody who reported the image to @TwitterSupport. Your kindness and decency made all the difference to my family and me. I\xe2\x80\x99d also like to thank @PoliceScotland for their support and assistance in this matter. 2/8'

b'Last Friday, my family\xe2\x80\x99s address was posted on Twitter by three activist actors who took pictures of themselves in front of our house, carefully positioning themselves to ensure that our address was visible. 1/8'
b'Woke up to a chocolate book, which I think you\xe2\x80\x99ll agree is a very nice way to wake up \xe2\x9d\xa4\xef\xb8\x8f\xf0\x9f\x8e\x84\xf0\x9f\x90\xb7 https://t.co/HHbefGhWJ1'

b'None of that may trouble you or disturb your belief in your own righteousness. But if so, I can\xe2\x80\x99t pretend I care much about your bad opinion of me. 11/11'

b'Carl Henegan, professor of evidence-based medicine at Oxford University, has described the off-label use of puberty blockers on under-18s as an \xe2\x80\x98unregulated live experiment on children\xe2\x80\x99. https://t.co/dDAqENLXor\n10/11'

b'The long-term health risks of cross-sex hormones have been now been tracked over a lengthy period. These side-effects are often minimised or denied by trans activists.\nhttps://t.co/fpIxW34AWr\n9/11'

b'Sophie is a trans woman and a true feminist ally. She was making the point that anti-depressants were over-prescribed to teenagers in the past, with serious consequences. https://t.co/yxuK2Mh49X 8/11'

b'As I\xe2\x80\x99ve said many times, transition may be the answer for some. For others, it won\xe2\x80\x99t \xe2\x80\x93 witness the accounts of detransitioners.\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe system sees surgery as the easy fix to girls who do not conform.\xe2\x80\x9d\n https://t.co/cr1Zi4JnWR 7/11'
b'These concerns were explored by the recent BBC documentary about the Tavistock Clinic. Whistleblowers were talking about transitions driven by homophobia. https://t.co/S0q88PeL65\n6/11'

b'Many, myself included, believe we are watching a new kind of conversion therapy for young gay people, who are being set on a lifelong path of medicalisation that may result in the loss of their fertility and/or full sexual function. 5/11'
b'Many health professionals are concerned that young people struggling with their mental health are being shunted towards hormones and surgery when this may not be in their best interests. 4/11'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve written and spoken about my own mental health challenges, which include OCD, depression and anxiety. I did so recently in my essay \xe2\x80\x98TERF Wars\xe2\x80\x99. I\xe2\x80\x99ve taken anti-depressants in the past and they helped me. 3/11'
b'When you lie about what I believe about mental health medication and when you misrepresent the views of a trans woman for whom I feel nothing but admiration and solidarity, you cross a line. 2/11'

b"I accept @lloyd_rm's apology in the hope that he\xe2\x80\x99ll dig a little deeper than hashtags and slogans. He might then understand why increasing numbers of people are deeply concerned about @UKLabour\xe2\x80\x99s position on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights. 9/9"

b"Andrea Dworkin wrote: \xe2\x80\x98Men often react to women\xe2\x80\x99s words\xe2\x80\x94speaking and writing\xe2\x80\x94as if they were acts of violence; sometimes men react to women\xe2\x80\x99s words with violence.\xe2\x80\x99 It isn't hateful for women speak about their own experiences, nor do they deserve shaming for doing so. 8/9"

b'When so-called leftists like @lloyd_rm demand that we give up our hard won sex-based rights, they align themselves squarely with men\xe2\x80\x99s rights activists. To both groups, female trauma is white noise, an irrelevance, or else exaggerated or invented. https://t.co/4Axo36pGWt 7/9 https://t.co/vhvQRVRGHu'

b"As I stated in my essay, my primary worry is the risks to vulnerable women. As everyone knows, I\xe2\x80\x99m no longer reliant on communal facilities, nor am I likely to be imprisoned or need a women's refuge any time soon. I\xe2\x80\x99m not arguing for the privileged, but the powerless. 6/9"

b'Some emails came from professionals working in women\xe2\x80\x99s refuges, the prison service, the social work system, the criminal justice system and the police. All expressed concerns about the aims and methods of current trans activism. 5/9'

b'Since writing my essay, I\xe2\x80\x99ve received over 3000 emails thanking me for speaking up. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been brought to tears many times while reading, sometimes out of gratitude for their kindness, but also because many women have shared their own experiences of violence & sexual assault. 4/9'

b'For those who\xe2\x80\x99d like to know what triggered the shadow minister\xe2\x80\x99s original accusation, these are the relevant paragraphs of the essay I wrote a couple of weeks ago. The full piece can be read here https://t.co/Vs4V1yfGkA https://t.co/6H90WZfqPG'

b'This morning, Mr Russell-Moyle issued an apology on Twitter, although he didn\xe2\x80\x99t trouble to tag me in. Coincidentally, his change of heart occurred after his remarks were repeated in national newspapers with higher circulations than @tribunemagazine. 2/9'

b'Today I discovered that I was accused of hate by shadow environment minister Lloyd Russell-Moyle in the pages of @tribunemagazine. He claimed I was \xe2\x80\x98using\xe2\x80\x99 my experiences of sexual assault and domestic violence to \xe2\x80\x98discriminate\xe2\x80\x99 against trans people. 1/9'

b'I respect every trans person\xe2\x80\x99s right to live any way that feels authentic and comfortable to them. b"However, I am not - as many of the people now swarming into my mentions seem to think - ashamed of reading about the assault. You should know by now that accusations of thought crime leave me cold. Take your censorship and authoritarianism elsewhere. They don't work on me."

b"I'm going to say this once and I'm going to say it calmly and politely. I certainly didn't mean to paste a quotation from a message about the assault of Maria Maclaughlin into a tweet to a child, especially given the language used by the person convicted of the crime 1/2"
b"@TaraOComics Of course I copied it. What I didn't mean to do was paste it into a message about a child's picture."
b'@NicESpurling OK, time to take this off Twitter, I think.'
b"@StephPerniciaro It didn't... I'm mortified! This is what happens when you're not paying attention and accidentally cut and paste from an ENTIRELY different kind of message."

b'Anyway, over the last few weeks I\xe2\x80\x99ve done a bit of rewriting 
and I\xe2\x80\x99ve decided to publish the Ickabog for free online, 
so children on lockdown, or even those back at school during these strange, unsettling times, can read it or have it read to them.

7/13'
b'Absolutely no idea what inspired this doodle.\n\n6/13 https://t.co/dGKa3fKFNY'

b"Opening the box was like opening a time capsule. Most of the story was handwritten, but bits had been typed up. When I put it into some kind of order (I'm not renowned for my filing skills) I had a patchwork first draft.\n\n5/13 https://t.co/mz1qaGyyUt"

b"Over time I came to think of The Ickabog as just for my family. The manuscript went up into the attic, where it remained until a few weeks ago. 

This is the very dusty box I got down from the attic. 
(It's a Net-A-Porter box and might well have held a premiere dress.)

4/13 https://t.co/vg8F5Qx33M"

b'I always meant to publish it, but after the last Potter 
was released I wrote two novels for adults and, after some dithering, decided to put those out next.

Until very recently, the only people who\xe2\x80\x99d heard the story of 
The Ickabog were my two younger children.

3/13'

b'Over 10 years ago, I wrote a stand-alone fairy tale called 
The Ickabog. You can read more about how, why and 
when The Ickabog was written at https://t.co/MgH9NZnSAS

2/13'

b'may need help from an arts programme, too, and I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t want her to be unable to fulfil her potential because the money wasn\xe2\x80\x99t there. Art matters, even in terrible times. Books have always been my greatest refuge and I know I\xe2\x80\x99m not alone. /6X'

b'The priority right now is saving lives, but I felt obliged to point out that I *did* receive government assistance through an arts programme. One of the many reasons I feel strongly that people like me should pay their full share of taxes is that the next JK Rowling /4'

b'However, even in wartime, filmmakers, writers and performers were supported by government to do the necessary work of improving morale and providing people with a necessary means of escape and respite. Art is unique to humanity and it bolsters our humanity. /4'

b'In times like these, and speaking as somebody who has several key workers in her immediate family, I can see why some people might regard artists, writers etc as about as much use as Cacofonix the Bard on the battlefield (Asterix reference, if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t read it, do) /3'

b'However, you also seem to be asserting that I never benefited from government support as an artist. This is inaccurate. I received a grant from a government supported arts programme that enabled me to finish my second book. /2'
